Sentencas: An experimental study has been conducted at Idaho National Laboratory to demonstrate recent improvements in long-term durability of solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOEC) and stacks.
Titulo: Improved durability of SOEC stacks for high temperature electrolysis

Sentencas: Results of five stack tests are presented.
Titulo: Improved durability of SOEC stacks for high temperature electrolysis

Sentencas: Electrolyte-supported SOEC stacks were provided by Ceramatec Inc. and electrode-supported SOEC stacks were provided by Materials and Systems Research Inc. (MSRI), for these tests.
Titulo: Improved durability of SOEC stacks for high temperature electrolysis

Sentencas: Long-term durability tests were generally operated for durations of 1000 h or more.
Titulo: Improved durability of SOEC stacks for high temperature electrolysis

Sentencas: Stack tests based on technologies developed at Ceramatec and MSRI have shown significant improvement in durability in the electrolysis mode.
Titulo: Improved durability of SOEC stacks for high temperature electrolysis

Sentencas: Long-term degradation rates of 3.2%/khr and 4.6%/khr were observed for MSRI and Ceramatec stacks, respectively.
Titulo: Improved durability of SOEC stacks for high temperature electrolysis

Sentencas: One recent Ceramatec stack even showed negative degradation (performance improvement) over 1900 h of operation.
Titulo: Improved durability of SOEC stacks for high temperature electrolysis

Sentencas: Optimization of electrode and electrolyte materials, interconnect coatings, and electrolyte electrode interface microstructures contribute to improve the durability of SOEC stacks.
Titulo: Improved durability of SOEC stacks for high temperature electrolysis
